title: Energy policy of China
summary: Ensuring adequate energy supply to sustain economic growth has been a core concern of the Chinese government since 1949.[1]  The country is the world's largest emitter of greenhouse gases, and coal in China is a major cause of global warming.[2] However, from 2010 to 2015 China reduced energy consumption per unit of GDP by 18%, and CO2 emissions per unit of GDP by 20%.[3] On a per-capita basis, it was the world's 51st largest emitter of greenhouse gases in 2016.[4]
